Filter Name in document: First AVP is SessionId validation Filter
Filter Name in RMT: Deny incoming messages if the first AVP is not Session-ID
Description: Deny any Incoming messages if the first AVP is not Session-ID.
Value Alias A: If will be rejected and logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and the reject code

Filter Name in RMT: Single occurrence of Origin-Realm validation of incoming messages
Description: Deny an incoming message if the message includes more than one Origin-Realm (AVP296).
Value Alias A: If will be logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and reject code

Filter Name in RMT: Single occurrence of Origin-Host validation of incoming messages
Description: Deny an incoming message if the message includes more than one Origin-Host (AVP294).
Value Alias A: If will be logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and reject code

Filter Name in RMT: Single occurrence of Destination-Realm validation of incoming messages
Description: Deny an incoming message if the message includes more than one Destination-Realm (AVP283).
Value Alias A: If will be logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and reject code

Filter Name in RMT: Single occurrence of Vendor-specific-application-id validation of incoming messages
Description: Deny an incoming message if the message includes more than one Vendor-specific-application-id (AVP260).
Value Alias A: If will be logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and reject code

Filter Name in RMT: Single occurrence of Visited-PLMN-id validation of incoming messages
Description: Deny an incoming message if the message includes more than one Visited-PLMN-id (AVP1407).
Value Alias A: If will be logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and reject code

Filter Name in RMT: Command-Code and Application ID validation of incoming messages
Description: Command-Code validation of incoming messages. Only command code of 316,318,321,323,317,319,320,322 under application ID 16777251 will be allowed.
Value Alias A: If will be logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and reject code

Description: Only allow message with Origin-Realm within pre-approved Origin-Realm list to be sent from customer's source peer(identified by realm of the peer).
Value Alias A: If will be logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and reject code
Key2 Alias B: Message with Original Realm to be whitelisted

Filter Name in document: Inbound Roamer HOME IMSI Blacklist filter
Filter Name in RMT: Inbound Roamer HOME IMSI Blacklist filter
Description: Deny incoming request messages  (IDR/CLR/DSR/RSR) from customer's and roaming partner's HSS sending to customer MME if IMSI prefix of the message belongs to customer.
Value Alias A: If will be logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and reject code

Filter Name in document: Outbound Roamer HOME IMSI Whitelist filter
Filter Name in RMT: Deny outgoing request messages from customer's HSS sending to MME if IMSI prefix of the message does not belong to customer
Description: Deny incoming request messages  (IDR/CLR/DSR/RSR) from customer's and roaming partner's HSS sending to customer MME if IMSI prefix of the message belongs to customer.
Value Alias A: If will be logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and reject code
Key2 Alias B: IMSI prefix to be white listed

Description: Only allow message with Origin-Realm within pre-approved Origin-Host list to be delivered. Customer must notice Syniverse DSS team at least one week before any new MME/HSS/DEA to be added in live network if this filter is turned on.
Value Alias A: If will be logged in security TDR(1 stands for Yes) and reject code

Description: Host-IP-address validation filter for Outgoing messages. Messages sending from invalid peer IP will be dropped.
Vadilate IPv4 address parameter(s) of a received SCTP-INIT / SCTP-INIT-ACK message. Vadilation will not be performed under single home mode or if customer is using NAT.

Diameter CER/CEA validation filter for Diameter Peer handshake. Origin-Host AVP,Origin-Realm AVP,Host-IP-Address AVP will be checked. Vadiliation will not be performed if customer is using NAT IP or one customer peer have more than 2 SCTP IP addresses.
